shippingstore

Class PackageDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • shippingstore.PackageDatabase

  • public class PackageDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to represent a database interface for a list of Package Order's. It using a plain-text file "PackageDB.ser" to store and write package order objects in readable text form. It contains an ArrayList called packageOrderList to store the database in a runtime friendly data structure. The packageOrderList is written to "PackageDB.ser" at the end of the PackageDatabase object's life by calling flush(). This class also provides methods for adding, remove, and searching for package orders from the list.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PackageDatabase()
      This constructor is hard-coded to open "PackageDB.ser" and initialize the packageOrderList with its contents.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PackageDatabase

        public PackageDatabase()
                throws java.io.IOException
        This constructor is hard-coded to open "PackageDB.ser" and initialize the packageOrderList with its contents. If no such file exists, then one is created. The contents of the file are "loaded" into the packageOrderList ArrayList in no particular order. The file is then closed during the duration of the program until flush() is called.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • showPackageOrders

        public void showPackageOrders()
        Method showPackageOrders displays the current list of package orders in the Arraylist in no particular order.

      • findPackageOrder

        public int findPackageOrder(java.lang.String trackingNumber)
        This method can be used to find a package order in the Arraylist of orders.
        Parameters:
        trackingNumber - a String that represents the tracking number of the order that to be searched for.
        Returns:
        the int index of the package orders in the Arraylist of orders, or -1 if the search failed.

      • searchPackageOrder

        public void searchPackageOrder(java.lang.String trackingNumber)
        This method can be used to search for a package order in the Arraylist of orders.
        Parameters:
        trackingNumber - a String that represents the tracking number of the order that to be searched for.

      • addOrder

        public void addOrder(java.lang.String trackingnumber,
                     java.lang.String type,
                     java.lang.String specification,
                     java.lang.String mailingclass,
                     java.lang.String special1,
                     java.lang.String special2)
        This method is used to add a package order to the orderList ArrayList. In order for a package order to be added to the ArrayList it must comply with the following:

        1. The order is not already in the ArrayList according to the tracking number as the unique key.

        2. The TrackningNumber string matches the following regular expression: "[A-Za-z0-9]{5}" or in other words: it is 5 digit alphanumeric characters.

        3. The Type of the order can be only one of the following: Envelope, Box, Crate, Drum.

        4. The Specification of the order can be only one of the following: Fragile, Books, Catalogs, Do-not-Bend, N/A.

        5. The Mailing Class of the order can be only one of the following: First-Class, Priority, Retail, Ground, Metro.

        6. Special cases have varying requirements depending on type of package. Envelope: Height in inches 0-99 Box: Largest dimension in inches 0-999 Crate: Maximum Load Weight in lbs must be greater than 0.00 Drum: Material must be Plastic or Fiber

        7. Special cases have varying requirements depending on type of package. Envelope: Width in inches 0-99 Box: Volume in inches cubed 0-999999 Crate: Content of the crate Drum: diameter in inches 0-999

        Parameters:
        toAdd - the PackageOrder object to add to the packageOrderList

      • removeOrder

        public void removeOrder(java.lang.String trackingNum)
        This method will remove an order from the packageOrderList ArrayList. It will remove the instance of an order that matches tracking number that was passed to this method. If no such order exists, it will produce an error message.
        Parameters:
        trackingNum - the PackageOrder object to be removed.

      • getPackageOrder

        public PackageOrder getPackageOrder(int i)
        This method is used to retrieve the PackageOrder object from the PackageOrderList at a given index.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the desired PackageOrder object.
        Returns:
        the PackageOrder object at the index or null if the index is invalid.

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws java.io.IOException
        This method opens "PackageOrderDB.ser" and overwrites it with a serialization of all the package orders in the PackageOrderList. This should be the last method to be called before exiting the program.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
